result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Earl Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW hearing 4/22/2016 at 1:30 p.m. in BR. 24.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. Failure  to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No contact with victim Sandy G. unless approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention Program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Earl Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court PRO SE.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Court amended JOC to reflect 30 days condition time STAYED. Court admonished defendant for non-compliance. Further review needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed. Court amended JOC to reflect 30 days condition time STAYED. Court admonished defendant for non-compliance. Further review needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes if applicable  for father of only one 12 year old child.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute Sobriety.
-No contact with victim Sandy G. unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. 

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Case adjourned for a Probation Review Hearing on 4/22/2016 at 1:30pm in branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached an agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court VACATES Jury Trial on 1/19/2016. Defense requests a Sentencing Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.   
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sandy G, S.G.S. DOB 11/11/03.

Defendant Robert Earl Smith in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Defendant Robert Earl Smith in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert Earl Smith
Current: 5660 N 73rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: 2221 West Verona Court, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
